intro: Calendula vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clustered flower heads. Its blooming period occurs from late spring to early autumn, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Calendula vidalii is often used in traditional medicine and as a decorative garden plant.
